bibl.title: Davenport v. Sheehan. Memo from Petitioner Attorneys.
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image.

org.orgName: United States District Court of Washington Territory, Second Judicial District

div1.p: made an order requiring petitioner to enter into bond in the final sum of Two Thousand give hundred dollars, for his appearance at the District Court in said County to answer any Indictment that the Grand Jury might present against him upon said charge, and in default of said bond that the sheriff of said County of Whaltcom take him into his custody and hold him until discharged by due process of law:

That petitioner was and is unable to give said bond, which is exhorbitant, and that on the 23d day of September 1888 the sheriff of said County of Whatcom delivered petitioner to said Sheehan, without any writ on process of any kind whatever, and ever since said last named day said Sheehan has held, and still continues to hold, & confine petitioner without any process and without any right so to do.

Wherefore petitioner prays that your Honor grant him a writ of Habeas Corpus directed to said John F. Sheehan, requiring him to have petitioner before your HOnor at such time and place as to Your Honor may seem best, and that in facts with reference to said charge may be examined into, and petitioner discharged from further custody.
